abstracts.cdata!:
As in SAL I, this Second Structural
            Adjustment Loan Project addresses four main problem areas in
            the Jamaican economy: (i) a difficult balance of payments
            situation; (ii) inadequate public savings; (iii) sluggish
            performance of both the industrial and agricultural sectors;
            and (iv) an overregulated economy. In addition to improving
            these areas, the loan includes action programs to improve
            public administration and also aims to achieve economic
            deregulation and export development. Deregulation will
            permit market forces to determine more adequately the
            allocation of scarce resources. Export development is
            essential to the achievement of a viable balance of payments
            in the medium term. The loan will finance imported raw
            materials, intermediate goods, non-luxury consumer goods,
            capital equipment and spare parts. Counterpart funds are to
            be used for economic development related expenditures in the
            public sector investment program.
